skill.name: Global Tech Stack
skill.description: Understand and adhere to the project's technology stack including Laravel, PHP, React, PostgreSQL, Pest, Tailwind CSS, and all configured tools and services. Use this skill when making architectural decisions, when choosing libraries or packages, when configuring development tools, when setting up testing frameworks, when implementing authentication, when integrating third-party services, when configuring CI/CD pipelines, when setting up local development environments, or when ensuring consistency with the established tech stack across all parts of the application.
skill.summary: Understand and adhere to the project's technology stack including Laravel, PHP, React, PostgreSQL, P...
skill.author: DevanB

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable reading. The skill provides architectural guidance to AI assistants about technology stack consistency.

content.value_statement: This skill ensures AI assistants follow consistent development standards for Laravel, PHP, React, and related technologies. It provides specific guidance on architectural decisions, tool selection, and code conventions.
actual_capabilities: Guide architectural decisions for Laravel applications
Enforce PHP and Laravel coding conventions
Recommend appropriate Laravel packages and tools
Set up testing frameworks with Pest
limitations: Does not execute code or modify files directly
Does not install dependencies or configure systems
Provides guidance only, requires user implementation
Focused on Laravel ecosystem, may not cover other frameworks

use_cases.title: Maintain Code Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all code contributions follow Laravel conventions, use Pint for formatting, and apply Pest testing patterns.

use_cases.title: Architectural Consistency
use_cases.description: Make architectural decisions that align with the established tech stack, including authentication, caching, and CI/CD.

use_cases.title: Learn Best Practices
use_cases.description: Receive guidance on proper tool selection, testing approaches, and development environment setup for Laravel projects.

prompt_templates.title: Add New Feature
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding user authentication to the application
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Global Tech Stack skill to implement user authentication with Laravel Fortify, including proper validation, CSRF protection, and Eloquent relationships for users.

prompt_templates.title: Database Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the Global Tech Stack skill to create a Laravel migration for a new posts table, including proper indexes, foreign keys, and PostgreSQL conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Global Tech Stack skill to build a form component with Inertia.js, Tailwind CSS v4 styling, proper accessibility, and form validation.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the following code using the Global Tech Stack skill. Check for Laravel conventions, Pest test coverage, Tailwind v4 patterns, and proper Inertia.js usage.

output_examples.input: How should I implement a new API endpoint for listing blog posts?
output: Create a controller using Laravel's resource conventions
Use Eloquent API Resources for response formatting
Implement proper route naming with API versioning
Add Pest unit tests for the endpoint logic
Apply query optimization with eager loading
Use request validation through a Form Request class

best_practices: Apply Laravel conventions consistently across all files, including naming, structure, and coding patterns.
Use Pest for testing with proper factory usage and mocking strategies for external dependencies.
Configure Tailwind CSS v4 with custom theme extensions rather than legacy utility classes.
anti_patterns: Skipping Pest tests for new features reduces code quality and breaks development standards.
Using raw SQL queries bypasses Eloquent ORM protections and creates maintenance issues.
Applying Tailwind v3 utilities in a v4 project introduces deprecated patterns and inconsistencies.

faq.question: Which PHP and Laravel versions does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill covers PHP 8.4 and Laravel 12, along with Inertia v2, React 19, and Tailwind CSS v4.

faq.question: Does this skill work with other PHP frameworks?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically designed for Laravel applications and does not cover Symfony, CodeIgniter, or other frameworks.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with Vue.js instead of React?
faq.answer: No, the skill is configured for React and Inertia v2. Vue.js support would require a separate skill configuration.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external services when using this skill?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides guidance locally. No code or data is transmitted to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my code not formatting with Laravel Pint?
faq.answer: Run 'vendor/bin/pint' in your project root. The skill provides conventions, not automatic formatting execution.

faq.question: How does this skill compare to using Claude Code without it?
faq.answer: Without this skill, Claude Code may not apply Laravel-specific conventions, Pest testing patterns, or Tailwind v4 standards automatically.
